item.title: Report E-2024080511
item.description:
Report E-2024080511

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: DORAL
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS MIAMI FLORIDA FACILITY, ONE BLACK SHRINKED WRAPPED WOODEN SKID SHIPPING AIR CARGO SERVICE TO COLOMBIA WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN FLAMMABLE PRODUCTS. DURING THE SCREENING PROCESS WHILE CUTTING THE BLACK SHRINK WRAPPING, SEVERAL BOXES WERE FOUND WITH CLASS NINE DIAMOND LABELS AND AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. OTHER BOXES WERE FOUND WITH GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS OF THESE BOXES FOUND NUMEROUS FLAMMABLE PERFUMERY PRODUCTS. THE FREIGHT WAS OFFERED FOR AIR TRANSPORTATION TO UPS AIR CARGO WITHOUT ANY DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BLACK SHRINK WRAPPING. THERE WAS NO INDICATION ON THE AIR WAYBILL THAT DANGEROUS GOOD PRODUCTS WERE BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THE ISSUING CARRIER'S AGENT NAME AND CITY ON THE AIR WAYBILL IS ALSEATRANS US, 1665 NW 102ND AV, SUITE 108, MIAMI FL, 33172, US. THE SHIPPER'S NAME AND ADDRESS ON THE AIR WAYBILL IS MSL INTL GROUP, LLC, 1665 NW 102ND AV, MIAMI FL US.

RESPONDER IN FULL PPE PLACED PACKAGE INTO CHEMICAL RESIST TRAY, RESPONDER ABSORBED SMALL PUDDLE ON FLOOR OF THE TRUCK WITH ZEP, RESPONDER HEADED BACK TO THE DMP CAGE WITH PACKAGE TO BE PROCESSED. 2. item.title: Report E-2024080493
item.description:
Report E-2024080493

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: PEMBROKE PINES
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 6, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon container of ZeroTol® 2.0 was damaged and released approximately its full contents to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Safety (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel noted the release had previously been remediated by RLC personnel. AS personnel collected the one (1) empty damaged 5-gallon container of ZeroTol 2.0 and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum as waste. AS personnel then collected the cleanup debris and containerized it into the one (1) 55-gallon poly drum as well. All ZeroTol 2.0 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum that was staged on-site
